results.title: Pret-a-porter = Ready to wear
results.brief_description:
Every year in Paris, the top designers and supermodels stage the world’s hottest fashion show. It is called “Pret-a-Porter” and it means “Ready to Wear”. Only this time, there has been a murder and everyone is a suspect. Once again Altman gathers a remarkable ensemble cast of stars and celebrities to weave an elaborate interlocking web of stories and events. High fashion is subjected to the critical glare and ironic wit typical of Altman’s films, in this tangled tale of sex and sin, designed to seduce and dressed to kill.
Cast includes: Marcello Mastroianni, Sophia Loren, Jean-Pierre Cassel, Kim Basinger, Anouk Aimee, Rupert Everett, Lili Taylor, Forest Whitaker, Richard E. Grant, Julia Roberts, Tim Robbins, Lauren Bacall, Lyle Lovett, Tracey Ullman, Sally Kellerman, Teri Garr, Danny Aiello, Harry Belafonte, Cher, and an array of famous designers and models appearing as themselves.

results.title: The Blue kite
results.brief_description: The fate of a Beijing family under Mao Tse Tung’s regime from the early 1950’s to the Cultural Revolution is the focus of this film by talented filmaker Tian Zhuangzhuang. Seen from the perspective of Tietou who grows from child to adolescence as he observes his mother’s three marriages. Although epic in proportion, the intimacy of domestic life is a poignant contrast to the political dramas occuring. The film was banned in China but a print was smuggled out of the country allowing the rest of the world an opportunity to experience this inspirational human drama.

results.title: Acts of the Apostles
results.creator_credit: Roberto Rossellini and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description: This is a special catechetical edition of the film, running for almost 6 hours, and telling the story of the trials and tribulations of the Apostles of Jesus Christ from the immediate time after his crucifiction until the acceptance of the new religion of Christianity. The film is divided into 10 parts, the titles for the parts are: ‘Gift of the spirit: good news people’, ‘Jesus lives in his people’, ‘Witness to Jesus’, ‘Conversion and rebirth’, Salvation is open to all’, ‘Spreading the good news’, ‘A Tried faith’, ‘Sharing truth and love’, ‘People of the beatitudes’, ‘The Church: a unity of churches’. The film is dubbed in English.

results.title: Beat manifesto
results.creator_credit: Daniel Nettheim, Shilo McClean and AFTRS
results.brief_description: Hamish is a poet. He lives on a farm in the Australian Bush where he writes about the rural experience. His ambition is to become a Beat poet and travel to New York where he can read his poetry in a real jazz club. The experience is not what he anticpates. This film has been nominated and won several awards in Film Festivals world-wide including Venice and the AFI Awards.

results.title: Round up
results.creator_credit: Rima Tamou, Pauline Clague and Core Original Productions
results.brief_description: Two country boys, one white and the other aboriginal find themselves out of place in the hustle and bustle of the big city. What they learn on the journey that they embark upon through unfamiliar territory, is that they are not as different as they first thought.

results.title: Reap the wild wind
results.creator_credit: Cecil B. DeMille and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: Shipwreck on the Reef, Shipwreck on the Reef, this was the cry the local shipowners and salvage operators in Key West during the 1840’s awaited. Their business thrived on the cargo of wrecked ships but are all the wrecks caused by nature or man made? Why is it that King Cutler (Raymond Massey) always seemed to be the first on the scene? These and other questions are asked by local ship owner Loxi Claiborne (Paulette Goddard) and others. Meanwhile Loxi’s suitor Captain Jack Stuart (John Wayne) is suspected by the jealous lawyer Steve Tolliver (Ray Milland). Who will win in the romance stakes? The star studded cast includes Robert Preston, Susan Heywood, Charles Bickford, Walter Hampden and Janet Beecher. This Cecil B. DeMille production of piracy, hot-blooded love and huge clipper ships gliding in the mist won an Academy Award for its Special Effects and was based on a Saturday Evening Post story by Thelma Strabel.

results.title: Husbands and wives
results.creator_credit: Woody Allen, Robert Greenhut and Tri-Star Pictures
results.brief_description: A long-time married couple played by Judy Davis and Sydney Pollack astound their friends (Woody Allen and Mia Farrow), by announcing their separation. The film gained notoriety not so much for itself, but because it was the last film that Allen and Farrow made before their own much publicised breakup. Allen uses handheld camera techniques which gives the film a documentary type feel. Judy Davis was nominated for an Academy Award for her performance and Woody Allen for the screenplay. Co-starring Juliette Lewis, Liam Neeson, Blythe Danner, Nora Ephron and Lysette Anthony.

results.title: Ghost in the shell (D)
results.creator_credit: Mamoru Oshii, Ken Iyadomi, Ken Matsumoto, Mitsuhisa ishikawa, Yoshimasa Mizou, Bondai Visual, Kodonsha and Manga Entertainment
results.brief_description: In the tradition of ‘Akira’, ‘Ghost in the shell’ features excellent animation which will impress. Set in the cyberspace worlds of artificial intelligence and sophisticated computer technology, this violent and complex adventure revolves around a ghostly agent whose job is to determine who is real and who is a cybernetic creation. When a master hacker learns to break into the minds of his victims, the ‘Ghost in the shell’ must foil his evil attempts.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Mamoru Oshii, Ken Iyadomi, Ken Matsumoto, Mitsuhisa ishikawa, Yoshimasa Mizou, Bondai Visual, Kodonsha and Manga Entertainment

results.title: Paper plates to silver spoons: the complete guide to table manners
results.brief_description: Designed as a quick guide to table manners, this American production will amuse and inform. Table manners, utensil use, correct posture and table settings are discussed for both formal and informal dining situations. Cultural differences in table manners are also discussed. After watching this, viewers will be able to handle any dining situation with confidence as well as learning when it is acceptable to put elbows on the table and eat with one’s fingers!

results.title: The Thing = The Thing from another world
results.creator_credit: Christian Nyby, Howard Hawks and Winchester Pictures Corp
results.brief_description: A science expedition in an isolated Arctic outpost discover that a mysterious craft has landed. Flown to the spot by Air Force Captain Hendry, they uncover a large saucer shaped object from the permafrost. They rescue its passenger, frozen in a block of ice. When it accidentally thaws, a giant humanoid vegetable (James Arness), stronger and swifter than a man, devoid of emotion, asexual and completely merciless is unleashed. The group are forced to defend themselves against the lone alien who plans to colonize Earth with its own kind. This first film about a space monster also happens to be the best. A classic blend of science fiction and horror, loosely based on the story “Who goes there?” by John W. Campbell, Jr. with tense direction, excellent performances and an eerie score by Dmitri Tiomkin. Co-starring Margaret Sheridan and Kenneth Tobey.
